tweets.text:
How many other rivers in England are having vast amounts of raw sewage dumped into them at this very second? "Exceptional circumstance"?

And the @EnvAgency does what exactly? https://t.co/8rarB1lphZ
@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Profuse nettle growth beside that outflow pipe indicates high phosphorous area. Nettle thrive in high Phosphorous soil's. That would indicate a continuous problem.

Leave this with you. You decide if its acceptable that rivers are treated like open sewers. The last 12 months I've filmed more sanitary products than fish underwater. The great sanitary migration is coming soon.
#Pollution #sewage #environment #rivers https://t.co/ju5B8Dve45
@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Would an 'exceptional circumstance ' now be when sewage is not dumped into the river?
And the @EnvAgency does what exactly? https://t.co/IpnaNQ1Ucf
@shaldonangler @EnvAgency @SouthWestWater This is a few weeks old, but.... https://t.co/prxFXn4yhC

Your opportunity to block Hinkley power station Fish Slaughter at Public Inquiry
Urgent action required to respond to @EnvAgency's notification & make a representation by 27th October
For more info see 
https://t.co/YVuvHFcJJm https://t.co/bwL3ahADoi

@TraceyMaryHart Yes I saw that report somewhere. The storm sewerage system here is no longer suitable for a climate with more extreme rainfall events but @EnvAgency will not force @SouthWestWater to do anything. It‚Äôs üí©
@shaldonangler I‚Äôm sure I read last week that all England‚Äôs rivers had higher than allowed toxicity levels?

With regret we have to announce that we received notification from @thameswater this morning that the Chesham Sewage Treatment Works started discharging untreated sewage yesterday into the @RiverChess downstream of Blackwell Hall Lane. Keep yourself and pets out of the River. https://t.co/YRT5n3DvR1

@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency I worked for a very short time at Thames Water 10 years ago. Remember a senior manager saying he‚Äôd been woken during the night to authorise release of sewage into the Thames. It sounded too much like a boast to me. Left very shortly after. Seems there‚Äôs been no improvement.
@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Notes it.

With regret we have to announce that we received notification from @thameswater this morning that the Chesham Sewage Treatment Works started discharging untreated sewage yesterday into the @RiverChess downstream of Blackwell Hall Lane. Keep yourself and pets out of the River.

Look who was found in the #Thames recently! Historically a common sight, the migratory Twaite shad is now rare and it was great to see it near Blackfriars in Central London! #WorldFishMigrationDay #LRW2020 #LondonRiversWeek #TidewayLondon https://t.co/MjBH1APVkg

My visitors ( Salmon, Eels, Seatrout and Lamprey) used to come in their thousands now very few. Humans, it doesn't have to be this way. This is where we all are since 1970, just 50 years. @WGEnviroAgri @lesley4wrexham @NatResWales @EnvAgency @pow_rebecca @LukePollard https://t.co/h4HHhVLxoM https://t.co/A8QDRWp9gg

tweets.text: Our new river site from the air, new habitats establishing & public access track nearly complete. A fantastic community effort at our @EPIC_Sompting project. Cleaner water and inspired community thanks to @HeritageFundL_S  @EnvAgencySE  @SussexGiving @SomptingDowns https://t.co/i6ukX73EzA

Today, to celebrate #WorldFishMigrationDay we are delighted to release this short film showcasing the project‚Äôs first weir removal!

Watch the full film hereüêühttps://t.co/XatLeAsulq 

#LIFEDeeRiver @NatResWales @EnvAgencyNW @visitsnowdonia @DwrCymru @LIFEprogramme @fishmigration
Greenwashing at it‚Äôs finest, and the perpetrator of this obscenity? Why the @EnvAgency. https://t.co/KniMhKoCwV

urls.title: Sewage signals early warning of coronavirus outbreaks
urls.description: Government-led programme is providing an early warning of coronavirus outbreaks by monitoring sewage and sharing data with NHS Test & Trace

tweets.text:
The UK has made a breakthrough in using science to tackle #coronavirus.  

Scientists can now use sewage to detect local outbreaks, even when people don't show symptoms.  

Find out more: https://t.co/JEJxbjIMR0 

#CovidSewageTesting @DHSCgovuk @EnvAgency https://t.co/vW5ratcTmN

tweets.text: Tape it off as an #envirocrimescene. Deep shame on @thameswater for that, and the @EnvAgency  @EmmaHowardBoyd crew for complicity https://t.co/g1Wu8fCPPR

@oliverpitt @EnvAgency Believe it or not but, according to the data I have in front of me, @wessexwater wouldn't win, not even close.

Top of league Division 1. @YorkshireWater with a whopping 616,643 hours worth of sewage dumped into rivers in 2019 followed by @stwater with a hefty 272,518 hours.

Superb @CommonsEFRA session with @EnvAgency on #flooding this afternoon. @DefraGovUK have published their new #floodplan today & we will continue to scrutinise govt. policy in this area for all those affected by flooding! https://t.co/Nf2aen6Cal
